# datadog_logs_restriction_query (Resource)

Provides a Datadog Log Restriction Query resource. This can be used to create and manage Datadog Log Restriction Queries.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Manage a Datadog log restriction query
resource "datadog_logs_restriction_query" "test_lrq" {
  restriction_query = "service:foo"

  role_ids = [
    "00000000-0000-1111-0000-000000000000",
    "11111111-1111-0000-1111-111111111111",
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `restriction_query` (String) The query that defines the restriction. Only the content matching the query can be returned.

### Optional

- `role_ids` (Set of String) An array of role IDs that have access to this restriction query.

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) Creation time of the restriction query (in ISO 8601).
- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `modified_at` (String) Time of last restriction query modification (in ISO 8601).

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import datadog_logs_restriction_query.test_lrq "<restriction_query_id>"
```
